title: Test Bridge Implementation Complete
content:
Successfully implemented test bridge injection system for autonomous GitHub Copilot testing according to copilot-testing-readiness-gap-analysis-revised.md.

IMPLEMENTED COMPONENTS:
1. Test Bridge Source (src/test-bridge.js) - Exposes __COPILOT_TEST_BRIDGE__ API with 10 methods:
   - createQuickTab, getQuickTabs, getQuickTabById
   - minimizeQuickTab, restoreQuickTab  
   - pinQuickTab, unpinQuickTab
   - closeQuickTab, waitForQuickTabCount, clearAllQuickTabs

2. Injection Script (scripts/inject-test-bridge.cjs) - Automatically injects test bridge during TEST_MODE builds:
   - Copies test-bridge.js to dist/
   - Appends to dist/background.js
   - Updates manifest.json web_accessible_resources
   - Includes verification

3. Build Scripts - Added build:test npm script that runs injection

4. Test Utilities (tests/extension/helpers/extension-test-utils.js) - ExtensionTestHelper class wrapping test bridge via page.evaluate()

5. Basic Tests (tests/extension/quick-tabs-basic.spec.js) - 8 test scenarios covering all test bridge methods

6. Playwright Configs - Updated firefox and chrome configs to point to tests/extension directory

7. Verification Script (scripts/verify-test-bridge.cjs) - Checks all components are in place

SECURITY MODEL:
Test bridge only injected during TEST_MODE=true builds, not in production. No runtime environment checks needed since file presence itself indicates test mode.

VERIFIED WITH CONTEXT7:
- WebExtensions API usage (browser.tabs.query, browser.tabs.sendMessage, browser.storage.local) matches Mozilla documentation
- Playwright MCP integration patterns verified against microsoft/playwright-mcp docs
